meanings.definition: Existing or occurring outside of the text.
meanings.sent1: The extratextual clues helped the students understand the story better.
meanings.sent2: The teacher discussed the extratextual elements that shaped the author's writing.
meanings.sent3: The extratextual details in the book made the class burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her extratextual knowledge of the author's life added depth to her analysis.
meanings.sent5: The extratextual world created by the author was vivid and captivating.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to elements outside of the text that influence its interpretation.
meanings.sent1: The extratextual references in the movie enhanced the viewer's understanding.
meanings.sent2: Literary critics often analyze the extratextual factors that shape a work's meaning.
meanings.sent3: The extratextual hints in the play made the audience gasp in surprise.
meanings.sent4: His extratextual influences were like invisible hands guiding his writing.
meanings.sent5: The extratextual impact of the historical context was profound.

meanings.definition: Referring to information or context that is not explicitly stated in the text.
meanings.sent1: The extratextual knowledge she possessed helped her interpret the poem.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often delve into extratextual details to uncover hidden meanings.
meanings.sent3: The extratextual insights she shared left everyone amazed.
meanings.sent4: His extratextual understanding of the culture enriched his reading experience.
meanings.sent5: The extratextual connections she made were enlightening.
